top_categories.workout_context: Garmin Gravel Worlds’s nebraska farmland, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Garmin Gravel Worlds isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Garmin Gravel Worlds’s nebraska rolling farmland gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
Garmin Gravel Worlds rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Garmin Gravel Worlds when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Garmin Gravel Worlds’s nebraska rolling farmland gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Garmin Gravel Worlds. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Garmin Gravel Worlds — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The varied gradients at Garmin Gravel Worlds reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Garmin Gravel Worlds — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on nebraska rolling farmland gravel.
Every session at Garmin Gravel Worlds intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Garmin Gravel Worlds — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Garmin Gravel Worlds’s 65 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Garmin Gravel Worlds requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on nebraska rolling farmland gravel to build confidence. Expect: nebraska farmland, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and Durability to prepare you for 65 miles of nebraska rolling farmland gravel in Lincoln, Nebraska.
